data.text: With 100 days to go until we leave the EU, the government is in chaos and the prime minister has lost control. The sensible and responsible thing to do is suspend Article 50. https://t.co/O3oBnMROJ8
Fantastic news! A big win for a great bunch of workers. Unions making a difference! https://t.co/QGbmG03lLl

The PM must accept that she has lost the confidence of parliament and call a general election. Right now, we need Article 50 to be extended, suspended or withdrawn to give more time. And one way or another we must give people the final say on Brexit.
We’ve said all along that the PM’s deal is bad for jobs and rights at work. But delaying the vote is desperate stuff from a government in chaos.
RT @The_TUC: This deal threatens the rights of working people https://t.co/f4NJuRnK5y

Today I’ve written to every MP about Mrs May’s Brexit deal. This is a bad deal for working people: bad for jobs and bad for rights. Trade unions can’t support it – and MPs shouldn't either. https://t.co/lz4Dhjzqcv
Proud to be with @The_TUC delegation at the @ITUC world congress in Copenhagen, standing for workers' power and stronger rights around the world #ituc18 https://t.co/j6E85li1U6
Rest in peace @Harryslaststand. A life well-lived and an inspiration to us all to carry on the fight for justice.
I was delighted to contribute to the #FirstAmongEquals exhibition at the @FoundlingMuseum. Running until January and definitely worth a visit. https://t.co/cPizDJc4Ln https://t.co/0feaKVNACS

Wishing you the very best @Harryslaststand. You're in all our thoughts. 

#IStandWithHarry

Trade unions have been clear that any Brexit deal would have to safeguard rights at work, otherwise we couldn’t support it. And the PM's deal doesn’t come close. 
https://t.co/2JxmDGVlyd
Just goes to show that the Political Declaration isn't worth the paper it's written on. Can't trust this government not to cave to the Tory hardliners. https://t.co/mKqanttCk1

MPs must not be bullied into voting for this – ‘my deal or no deal’ isn’t a real choice. The PM must secure an extension of the Article 50, so the country can come together and find a real alternative.
The government has failed to deliver for working people in this country. This is a blindfold Brexit that doesn’t guarantee jobs or rights at work. #BrexitDeal

Rest in peace Max Levitas, Cable Street veteran, committed anti-racist and simply a lovely man. Sympathy to his family and many friends.

https://t.co/7Zb48CyVR3

If workers stand together, we can stop sexual harassment once and for all. We know the best way to take action is through a union - so let's get organising in the tech sector. #GoogleWalkout https://t.co/NgqtfxkBKV

After eight years of cuts and hardship, working people deserve better than the Chancellor's "little extras". 

This isn't the change we need. 

#Budget2018
Budgets are about political priorities. This government could choose to invest in working people, public services and good jobs. But I'm not holding my breath. #Budget2018

Solidarity to the brave women on strike in Glasgow today. Workers like these are the backbone of our public services and our communities. Equal pay is the very least they deserve. #GlasgowWomensStrike
A pleasure to visit @PresidentIRL, to celebrate the shared history and values of the British and Irish trade union movents.Go raibh maith agat, a Uachtaráin! https://t.co/h3UgaWXg60
RT @PresidentIRL: President Higgins received Ms. Frances O’Grady, General Secretary of @The_TUC, on a courtesy call at Áras an Uachtaráin.…

The wrong Brexit deal will allow our rights to be watered down by politicians who don't care about working people. We need a common rule book - and the best way to achieve that is through the single market. https://t.co/HjltjZ61Uw
I'm so proud of the workers today who are taking back power and standing up to giant corporations. We're fighting back, we're organising and we'll win. #FFS410 #McStrike https://t.co/w5uqzoAmL8

Fighting fascism is part of our movement's DNA. Whenever the far-right marches or tries to attack mosques and synagogues, we don’t retreat. Like the heroes of Cable Street 82 years ago today, we stand firm with the message: you will not pass.
https://t.co/nNqmSHDf0i
The PM's speech shows the government has run out of ideas. Working people deserve better. #CPC18

Solidarity with the working women of Glasgow who have voted by a landslide to strike for equal pay. Jimmy Reid would have been proud of these brave women and the unions that represent them - and I am too. @gmb_union @unitetheunion @unisontweets  https://t.co/lt2VhqOjxA

The same rightwing think tanks behind Trump's agenda plan to carve-up our NHS and tear down hard-won workers' rights. 
https://t.co/iikKQVddVt

Theresa May’s ‘my deal or no deal’ approach is denying parliament a real choice and is holding the country to ransom. She needs to be straight with us. Her deal will hit jobs and livelihoods and won’t protect rights at work. https://t.co/qr3DwhS6xz

The Home Secretary’s ‘shock-and-awe’ strategy means workers’ rights would be early casualties of a Tory Brexit. Don’t let the Tories take your rights away - working people need to have their say https://t.co/yvVRgfQPi5
Good to see government finally taking @POAUnion concerns seriously. It shows what unions can do when members stand together for safe work places. Now let's see some change.
No one going to work should be at risk of violent assault. Government must address the root causes of the problems in our prisons and keep staff safe. @POAUnion https://t.co/8MwZrratGZ

"For every oppressed worker there should be an organisation which can speak truth to power with conviction and strength."

A pleasure to welcome @JustinWelby to Congress this morning, to celebrate our birthday and our shared vision for a more just and equal society.

#TUC150 https://t.co/3LTtcmWmOr

Mrs May. If you won't give us the New Deal that working people demand, then stand down.
And take your ‘do nothing’ government with you.
Give us a General Election.
And we’ll do every thing in our power to elect a Prime Minister who will.
#TUC150 https://t.co/MVmg8VoZZb

Today I'm putting the PM on notice. If her deal doesn’t deliver for working people, then the TUC will throw our weight behind the call for a popular vote on the terms of Brexit. https://t.co/eZUqHSl3OK
The economy exists to serve the needs of the people, not the other way around. But that's not how Britain works right now. It's time for radical change. #economicjustice https://t.co/Q8EHeeJFKx
These papers confirm that a #NoDealBrexit isn't a credible option. It would be devastating for working people. Government must pull out all the stops to get a deal that delivers for the whole UK.
Solidarity to our friends at Bookmarks. Another sinister reminder of the growing confidence of the far right. https://t.co/iZmChat5gp
After seven years of pay restraint, it's time every public sector worker got an above-inflation pay rise. My latest on yesterday's pay settlement: https://t.co/mNvGXCOKkL
I know @pcs_union will bounce back and continue this vital campaign. But today's result shows that e-balloting is long overdue. Well over a year since govt opened consultation.

85% support for strike action in @pcs_union ballot, but result will be thrown out thanks to the undemocratic TU Act. Anti-union laws doing what they're designed for – stopping workers from winning a fair pay deal.

Northern Ireland has been treated as an afterthought at every stage in this Brexit process. And even now, PM would rather snipe at EU than come up with a workable plan. Without agreement on NI, there will be no Brexit deal. It’s that simple. https://t.co/4l8jv9uAFO
HOPE not hate plays a crucial role in the campaign against the far right. You can donate to their action fund here: https://t.co/lM79PVtjey
HOPE not hate deserves huge credit for exposing this plot. This case, and last weekend’s violent attacks by Tommy Robinson supporters, show the far right is a growing menace. https://t.co/KqMYYyghZy
Today I wrote to government calling for an urgent meeting on far-right extremism and fascism. We must stand up to these forces of hatred and division. https://t.co/UbxgoIdIIU
Trade unions have a long history of standing up to bullies and bigots. That's why we're march against Trump in London today. Join us! https://t.co/G5ZWU5egaM
Can't believe it's taken two years to get to this point. A white paper full of holes, that delivers little or nothing for working people. Rights, jobs and livelihoods are still at risk.

All solidarity to the brave women speaking out on #BBCPanorama tonight. In his words and actions, Donald Trump has shown himself to be a woman-hater. PM should not be rolling out the red carpet for him.
Fantastic news! Congrats to @unisontweets, to brilliant members in WWL and to everyone who supported the campaign. A perfect way to mark #NHS70 https://t.co/NxOHjrcW2d

As the government prepares for its Chequers meeting, Jaguar Land Rover warns of the reality of a hard Brexit. Time for the PM to put the country first and stand up for people's jobs. https://t.co/HSigGI23BQ

Happy birthday to our NHS, built for and by working people. Trade unionists will never stop fighting for the idea that everyone – whatever their background or means – deserves access to world-class healthcare. #NHS70

"The cost of disagreement between the UK and the EU would be dire for firms, workers and communities. We're calling on negotiators to inject pace and urgency into the Brexit process" - our joint statement with @CBItweets, @etuc_ces and @businesseurope https://t.co/b7mIlVYRHI
Looking forward to marching this Saturday to celebrate our NHS and all the brilliant people who work in it. Hope to see many of you there! #OurNHS70 https://t.co/7pBBlGewi2

My dad worked at Cowley for years. Devastating to hear that it could close, and that working families could lose their livelihoods. This is what a hard Brexit really looks like. https://t.co/J4sOgQQ2l7 #BMW
Congratulations @GMB_union on another big result! Gig economy workers need trade unions in their corner - we'll take on dodgy employers and we'll win! https://t.co/3P1nwiOPiy
Brexit is not a game. Thousands of jobs are at risk. Government must stop playing with people's lives. https://t.co/nxeYmHSZzH

The government has starved the NHS of funding for the last eight years.This money may keep the health service off life support. But hospitals still face huge challenges and adult social care remains in crisis. https://t.co/FDR9IRxXgh

One year on from Grenfell, we send our solidarity and support to everyone affected. You're entitled to truth and justice - and we'll stand with you all the way. 

We must all recommit our absolute resolve: never, ever again.
Important Supreme Court decision against Pimlico Plumbers. Sham self-employment is being used to deny workers their basic rights. Time to end the Wild West in the gig economy. https://t.co/4OSLCQ1dSU
Another reminder that we must never underestimate the threat of far-right extremism. Glad @hopenothate are on the case. https://t.co/XUbVTMUhTH https://t.co/v1R2lE1B48

Wage growth is stuck in the slow lane - real wages still at 0.4%. At this rate pay packets won’t return to pre-crash levels for years. We need to speed it up by extending collective bargaining & boosting union rights https://t.co/ZYbHEVmfPN
A real pleasure to talk to @Mr_Dave_Haslam at @mchrhistfest on Friday. Thanks for all you do for us - can’t wait to read new book! #tuc150 https://t.co/OBHxLHeg4N
Another cabinet squabble, another meaningless proposal. This government is wasting people's time.
It took guts for the women at Ford Dagenham to strike for equal pay. 50 years on, let's channel their fighting spirit and finally win real equality at work. https://t.co/yqibSZYgTO

Great to visit Ford Dagenham yesterday to mark the 50th anniversary of the machinists' strike. And especially to meet Sheila Douglass, one of the incredible women who walked out that day. https://t.co/IDFkC5Xuli
Good to have frank conversations about the scale of the challenges we face - but also how committeed we are to tackling them as we mark #TUC150 https://t.co/CLHYeuF18z
@LexyTopping Thank you, Lexy!

"Business models have radically changed and unions have to change too" - my interview with the @guardian about why, on our 150th birthday, we're transforming the way we reach young workers. https://t.co/m1tuEZT11p

150 years ago today, our first Congress met in Manchester. 150 years fighting and winning for working people - and still going strong! On our birthday, there's no better time to join a union. https://t.co/c4UjlWLLrr #TUC150 https://t.co/kJySmNlma6

All solidarity to our Irish sisters and brothers today. Congratulations on a brave and inspiring campaign. Proud to stand with you. #Together4Yes #repealthe8th @TURepealthe8th @ICTU https://t.co/GZAnBG7re8

Once again no mention of a legal guarantee for workers' rights in the government's Brexit plan. UK workers need rights that keep pace with those in Germany, Ireland and Spain. It's time for legal guarantees not vague promises. https://t.co/uQ5ymnEIV6
Can we put that on the side of a bus? https://t.co/yZdum3jUq5

Solidarity with @unitetheunion TGI Friday's workers out on strike today. Wait staff were given two days’ notice before being stripped of 40% of their tips. Great to see brave young workers fighting back! 

Show your support: https://t.co/GI7d9yz0xi

Government about to announce renationalisation of East Coast mainline. Will they finally admit that privatisation has been a disaster for passengers and taxpayers alike? The line must remain in public ownership for good.
Thanks to everyone who braved the rain to help make our voices heard for a new deal for working people https://t.co/fvUrn58zNR #TUCnewdeal https://t.co/FEUASb2qpe
Stewards briefed, stage built, sensible shoes on. And thousands of brilliant trade unionists on their way from all over the country. See you soon! #TUCNewDeal https://t.co/dtYwgghwTi
Migrant workers should be able to stand up for their rights at work. But Home Office rules mean they can't go on strike without risking deportation. This has to be sorted out. https://t.co/7xlbLccAFn
Had enough of an economy that doesn’t deliver for working people? Join us on Saturday and march for the alternative. #TUCNewDeal https://t.co/KNbosyya0W
Here I am talking about what's going wrong in the world of work and what we need to do to fix it. For starters, join me at the #TUCNewDeal march and rally this Saturday. https://t.co/apoGrhKKQn
Young workers are shouldering massive risk. They're bearing the brunt of the rise in insecure work, and many have little prospect of a decent job, home or pension. Time for a new deal.
Solidarity to everyone out on #McStrike today. Keep fighting, keep winning! #MayDay https://t.co/rJYFNmZJiD
Oh Arsenal! 😩
Many congrats to Ruth and Jen! Union membership form is in the post 😉 https://t.co/Ngwtvp30kb

"A Brexit deal that puts political expediency above the interests of Northern Ireland would be a blight on our future" - my joint statement with @cbicarolyn on the need to avoid a hard border. https://t.co/xrr9n3310J
All solidarity to my student namesake in North Carolina! #NationalSchoolWalkout https://t.co/KwKsWaevlE
A real privilege to welcome Neville to our #BlackWorkers conference. The fight against racial injustice goes on, and trade unionists will always be part of it. https://t.co/kkvdT3C1zZ
Great piece from @DaveWardGS on why we must all march on 12 May in London - are you coming? https://t.co/W4zP2oWmCd
So pleased that @jeremycorbyn is able to join me and 1000s of marchers demanding a new deal for working people on 12 May in London #TUCNewDeal https://t.co/f0EBeT8ecz
Thanks @billybragg for backing workers on boards on #r4today this morning. Hope you share some home truths at the Bank of England this evening!
Good that Lords recognise the importance of enhanced protection for rights at work. But we need a guaranteed level playing field for workers' rights to be included in the final agreement.
Significant defeat for government in the Lords. To protect jobs, rights and livelihoods, government must keep both customs union and single market on the table.

The Windrush generation have nothing to prove. They were invited to come here as citizens, but 70 years on they're being treated like criminals. We owe them a debt of gratitude - not a hostile environment.
@Kevin_Maguire Very sorry to hear, Kevin. Thinking of you and your family.
TGI Friday's facing the UK's first strike over unfair tipping policy. Solidarity to @unitetheunion members sticking up for themselves and their co-workers. ✊ https://t.co/fN4gOYjv8n

The Good Friday Agreement was signed 20 years ago today, giving new hope to people in Northern Ireland and far beyond. Trade unionists know how precious – and fragile – peace can be. And we’ll always stand up for it.
Great to meet @justintrudeau at the #L7 summit yesterday. Productive discussion about building a global strategy to create great jobs. https://t.co/IaHYKJKNfb
Powerful video to mark the 20th anniversary of the Good Friday Agreement. Whatever our politics, nothing matters more than peace. https://t.co/ayWdEE4pGJ
This takeover makes a mockery of govt’s much-hyped industrial strategy. And is a kick in the teeth for long-termism. #GKN staff deserved much better @unitetheunion
Govt has failed to protect #GKN workers against predatory takeover. Ministers got involved far too late and effectively rolled over.
David Davis must pay more attention to the impact his Brexit plans will have on women and other disadvantaged groups. No serious discussion so far.

@fawcettsociety @WomensBudgetGrp Women's rights at work are especially vulnerable under free trade deals that put corporations ahead of people. Rights to equal pay, decent maternity leave and national minimum wages were hard-won and can't be let slip.
Whenever the economy tanks, women bear the brunt. The same will be true of hard Brexit, as today's research from @fawcettsociety and @WomensBudgetGrp shows. https://t.co/gygsaog2zf
Delivery drivers obviously deserve basic rights like sick and holiday pay. It shouldn't take a tragedy for DPD – or any other company – to get the message. https://t.co/1nJM9TkS0r

@Keir_Starmer And he's right to take the UK's obligations to Northern Ireland seriously. We need a firm guarantee that there will be no checks, controls or physical infrastructure at the border. Vague promises won't cut it.

No deal would be the worst possible deal for our jobs, our rights at work and for the NI peace process. @Keir_Starmer is right to push for a meaningful vote in parliament - the government has ruled out too much to negotiate the best deal.
Soaring rents, crippling student debt and the longest pay squeeze since Napoleonic times. But yeah, socialism is the problem. https://t.co/hoYYeDnOHO

The French produce their own passports for national security reasons - and now they'll produce British passports too. Govt blaming EU rules is a smokescreen - they could easily take a stand for UK jobs.
Government must now make sure the rest of our hardworking public servants get the pay rise they've earned - and fund it properly.
The NHS deal is a good step towards fair pay for hardworking staff. Their dedication has kept the service running through unprecedented pressures and cuts.

The NUT's (@NEUnion) campaign against school cuts won £1.3bn in new money for schools and got 750k people to change their votes. Huge credit to them and everyone who got involved! https://t.co/shY0y3rpBN

The living standards crisis is still going strong, even if today's fall in prices eases the pressure a bit. Millions of workers haven't had a proper pay rise in years. Government must up its game. https://t.co/oxLYMOsjxN

Delighted to contribute to the #FirstAmongEquals display at the @FoundlingMuseum. I chose a telegram from a foster mum to her ‘darling’ Sam and a cold, clinical hospital letter to another foster parent. https://t.co/S27qvmRH6W
Very sad to hear about the death of Brenda Dean. A tough women, leader of SOGAT, who took the fight to Rupert Murdoch at Wapping.
Great to be at #britishkebabawards. Fab speech by @ibrahim_dogus celebrating the contribution of takeaway workers all over the country. Great food tonight too!

Good to meet @MichelBarnier in Brussels this morning. Told him that we need a level playing field for workers' rights, no undercutting and protection for the Good Friday Agreement. https://t.co/q8uKMNcdch
Good negotiators don’t box themselves in - today's EU guidelines show why. The PM's red lines are getting in the way of a jobs-first, rights-first Brexit.

Strange to see David Davis backing a trade deal with "zero tariffs on services", given that services aren't subject to tariffs. Our Brexit secretary should really know this stuff. https://t.co/RJtp3ZlCdh
Huge thanks to all those who've stepped up this week to keep our services running in nightmare conditions. Though someone needs to buy Ben some long trousers! https://t.co/Zx41KKyP4v
This speech changes nothing - more pie-in-the-sky logic from govt. We're still headed for a hard Brexit that undermines jobs, rights and the Good Friday Agreement.
The PM wants working people to "face the fact" that the UK won't get everything it wants in negotiations. But she still refuses to level with them about what the losses will be.
Touring the studios this morning, Chris Grayling admitted the UK won't “have everything that we might like” from the deal.  In other words, jobs are at stake.
Less than a year ago, Theresa May promised the Brexit trade deal would offer the “same benefits” as we have now. Expect her to break that promise in today’s speech.
Very sorry today for workers at Maplin and Toys R Us. Public investment and stronger workers' rights can help guarantee great jobs for everyone, wherever they are.
20 years on from the Good Friday agreement, it’s sickening to see hard Brexiteers like Boris Johnson undermining it. My latest for the @guardian: https://t.co/JUxhSJULuz
Let's be crystal clear. Threat of hard border (and unravelling of Good Friday Agreement) is because of the government's self-defeating red lines - and the reckless demands of hard Brexiteers

This morning Boris Johnson carelessly compared the Irish border to a London borough boundary. Now it’s revealed he doesn’t think stopping a hard border is worth bothering about anyway https://t.co/a9pTIYOEID
Planning to travel from Tottenham Court Road to Westminster this evening. Anyone know what the wait time at the border is like?
And solidarity to all @UCU members on the picket line today. Stay warm, stay strong! #USSStrike ❄️✊
Whatever the weather where you are, stay safe today. Bosses shouldn't force staff to make dangerous journeys to get to work. #beastfromtheeast
Staying in the single market currently looks like the best way to protect jobs, guarantee a level playing field for workers’ rights and safeguard the Good Friday Agreement
Good to hear @keir_starmer on #marr saying Labour will support staying in customs union & is focussed on getting benefits of single market for UK post-Brexit
A hard Brexit spells disaster for the Good Friday Agreement. Great piece from Fintan O’Toole - we should all be worried https://t.co/dNlVKtckXZ
All solidarity to @ucu members on strike today. Strength of feeling among university staff (and students) is clear. Employers must commit to serious negotiations. #USSstrike https://t.co/Ovk18Fuwxx
So proud to work for @The_TUC. Our movement will always fight and win for working people. #TUC150 https://t.co/v5On9sv3SE

UK workers need a guarantee that their rights will keep pace with those across Europe - currently the best way to do that would be sticking with the Single Market. Let’s set the bar higher than “not a dystopia”.
As David Davis promises a “race to the top” post-Brexit, his cabinet colleagues are chomping at the bit to slash workers’ rights. Government is clearly speaking with two heads.
Good to see. The best way we can currently see to protect rights at work into the future is staying in the single market. That’s what will prevent a race to the bottom. https://t.co/f7EQ4Ibk7X
It's clear as day: working people back the Working Time Directive. They don't want a Brexit that undermines paid hols, rest breaks and fair hours. https://t.co/eWrourt74a https://t.co/NJ9bJDp1Fa
I’ll be listening closely to what DD says tomorrow in Vienna. I suggest anyone worried about preserving our hard-won rights at work does the same.
Currently, the only way to make good on David Davis' promise not to scrap our rights at work after Brexit is to stay in the single market. Promises are nice, but guarantees are what workers need.
David Davis' promise not to scrap our rights at work after Brexit would be more believable if he & his colleagues hadn't voted against putting such promises in the EU Withdrawal Bill
It seems David Davis will tell Austrian biz leaders tomorrow that no one is planning a bonfire of our rights at work after Brexit. Has he not been listening to Johnson & Gove?
PS: if you’re really interested in EU state aid rules, I thought this longer piece was interesting https://t.co/u1SVn7DOww

Govt uses excuse of single market rules to stop it taking action to deliver better jobs we need. But clear that EU rules don't stop other countries supporting industry through national investment banks and better targeted state aid - see https://t.co/az7cMITp8p

And we need a National Investment Bank - like the TUC has been calling for since 2012 https://t.co/Hv86xZYdxH - building on the success of the Green Investment Bank before the Conservatives sold it off, and learning from Germany and other countries across the EU.
For a start, more ambitious use of state aid to support regional development. The Germans spend three times the amount we do on supporting growth through state aid.

Currently, the best option to protect jobs and rights at work after Brexit looks like staying in the single market and customs union. But we also need more action from government right now to deliver more & better jobs.
Looking forward to talking about Brexit and the good jobs we need at Labour's National Policy Forum #npf18 tomorrow. I'll be making the case for a Brexit that delivers good jobs across the country
We want a UK where workers’ rights keep getting better. Boris Johnson is offering the opposite. My latest: https://t.co/nhlntWMkvJ
The foreign secretary is on record as an opponent of paid holiday, parental and redundancy rights - do you trust him?
Today's speech from Boris is no olive branch. His divergence plans are all about scrapping hard-won rights to paid holidays, equal pay and safety at work.
More evidence that ministers see Brexit as a chance to worsen our rights at work https://t.co/9h8Na9OI0s

RT @unitetheunion: Shocked by what you’ve seen on @c4dispatches? Then >>
SIGN: Premier Inn: Clean up your act! Help Unite stop the exploita…

More proof that undermining workers’ rights is being discussed... https://t.co/OU82hrILnv

These measures won't change the balance of power in the modern workplace. The government's taken a baby step when it needed to take a giant leap. https://t.co/u5p7wqMFTD #TaylorReview
And to honour their memory (and cos we're still not there yet) I'm recommitting to fight for equality for working women everywhere #stillmarching

https://t.co/2GbkcKMYTA

The PM has to break free of Brexit extremists in her party and put working people first. And the best way to protect jobs, investment & rights at work is through single market and customs union.
By ruling out customs union, the government's choosing to put up barriers to UK trade with Europe after #Brexit. It'll be bad for jobs, bad for investment & bad for business https://t.co/IMPS9Sic6X
Great to see Michael D Higgins this morning. And to commemorate Eva Gore-Booth, an iconic Irish suffragist, artist and labour activist. @PresidentIRL https://t.co/zm0kbeVsX3
We hear endless news about internal ministerial squabbles, but little about how to protect workers' jobs and rights. Time to shape up.

Our car workers are some of the most dedicated out there. The government is letting them down: 
https://t.co/ucFjWHSxFI
The #Capita profit warning is really worrying. That’s why the @The_TUC is calling for an urgent risk assessment of all large outsourcing firms. We can’t afford another Carillion.

This is down to brave work by Ryanair pilots themselves and real persistence from @BALPApilots. Huge credit to all involved.

Today we remember but we must also do more. We must challenge anti-semitism and bigotry wherever we see them. #HolocaustMemorialDay
